text.p: These are the leading stories in the Algerian press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- "Terrorists" kill eight civilians in Hatatba village in Tipaza province, south of Algiers, on Wednesday night.
- The deputies in the National Assembly (lower house) ended debate on the legislative body rules.
- The Mediterranean Forum on security and cooperation, taking place in Algiers, showed that Algeria has recovered its leading diplomatic position in the region.
- Foreign ministers and government officials from 11 Mediterranean countries discuss cooperation on security and economic partnership.
- President Liamine Zeroual invites party leaders for another round of talks to prepare for local elections to be held before the end of this year.
- Algeria beat Mali 1-0 in an African soccer cup eliminating match.
